EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Turk Power Plant complies with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations. All employees

are informed of hazards in the workplace. Employees who work with potentially hazardous

substances receive proper training in the handling of those substances. This facility has

procedures in place to safely remove employees from areas in the unlikely event that a

hazardous substance release were to occur, and to put in place emergency notification and

response procedures.



2. Facility and Regulated Substances



Turk Power Plant is located in Fulton, AR. The regulated substance at this facility, anhydrous

ammonia, is used in a supply system for emissions reduction. In order to protect its employees,

the public and the environment, Turk Power Plant has an integrated safety management program

to prevent ammonia releases and mitigate the consequences of a release, should one occur.



3. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Ammonia Specific

Prevention



The Turk Power Plant facility has an emergency plan that addresses the response necessary for

a release of ammonia from the storage system. Because of the pungent odor of ammonia, any

leak is easily detected. The tank area is provided with ammonia detectors that sound an alarm if

ammonia is detected. The storage system is designed so that major components can be isolated

by closing selected valves. Further, system operators have been trained and are knowledgeable

in the safe operation of the storage system. In case of a release that could travel off the plant

property, calls would be made to the Fire Department and the County Disaster Services

Coordinator to assist in the response. Other state and federal notifications would be made as

required.



4. Five Year Accident History



There have been no reportable releases of ammonia.



5. Emergency Planning and Response



This facility has procedures in

place to respond to the release of a hazardous substance.

Employees are trained to evacuate their respective areas in accordance with OSHA 1910.38(a).

The Turk Power Plant coordinates with local responders on an annual basis.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Turk Power Plant expects to improve safety performance by emphasizing all elements of the

PSM/RMP program. All recommendations during the upcoming Process Hazard Analysis and compliance 

audit will be prioritized and addressed in a reasonable amount of time. Turk Power Plant expects to

evaluate each recommendation in a timely manner and implement, as soon as possible, those

recommendations that will reduce the possibility of a release and/or mitigate the consequences of

an unintentional release.
